page.title: 05 Maud Heath's Monuments
page.content:
Maud Heath's footpath starts at the top of{Wick Hill}where there is a tall pillar with a statue of Maud Heath on top. On the other side of the road is a stone with the words: From this Wick Hill begins the praise Of Maud Heath's gift to these highways The second monument was built in 1974 by the villagers of East Tytherton to commemorate Maud Heath's 500th aniversary. At{Kellaways}there is a pillar with three sundials and a raised footpath on sixty four arches leading over the River Avon. The Causeway ends at Chippenham with a plate fixed on a stone saying:
Hither extendeth Maud Heath's gift For where I stand is Chippenham Clift Erected in 1698. But given 1474.
